result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher M Kosakoski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Child Pornography by Person Under Age of 18, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).
  • Possession of Child Pornography by Person Under Age of 18, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).
  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

No computers.

Mental Health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
Sex offender assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
Cognitive Behavior Therapy.
Register as a sex offender.
Pursuant to 973.048, defendant to comply with the reporting requirements under 301.45 for the sex offender registry with DOC.
Court ordered defendant to provide DNA sample and imposed mandatory surcharges.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until civil rights are restored.

from defendant filed.
jad

Defendant Christopher M Kosakoski in court with attorney Daryl A. Kastenson.  Defendant Christopher M Kosakoski in custody.  Kevin R. Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by counsel and defendant.  Additional statements made by Ramona L.
AS TO EACH COUNT:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 3.5 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 209 days time served AS TO COUNT 1 ONLY.; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1.5 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS with the following conditions:
*Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the departament
*Sex offender assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department
*Seek and maintain  fulltime employment.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy
*Vocational/educational training
*Register as a sex offender
*No unsupervised contact with anyone under the age of 18
*Cannot possess, view or download any pornography
*No computers
The court STAYED the sentences and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 5 years with the following conditions:
*AS TO COUNT 2 ONLY: Defendant to serve 12 MONTHS in the House of Correction.  No good time credit.  Court stayed sentence to be used as sanctions.  Court ordered defendant to serve 10 days STRAIGHT time for 1st violation and to increase by an additional 10 days STRAIGHT time for each subsequent violation;
*Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the departament
*Sex offender assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department
*Seek and maintain  fulltime employment.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy
*Vocational/educational training
*Register as a sex offender
*No unsupervised contact with anyone under the age of 18
*Cannot possess, view or download any pornography
*No computers

Pursuant to 973.048, defendant to comply with the reporting requirements under 301.45 for the sex offender registry with DOC.  

AS TO EACH COUNT:
Court ordered defendant to provide DNA sample and imposed mandatory surcharges.
Defendant to pay DNA SURCHARGES and all other costs and any other surcharges during probation and/or by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison funds and to convert to civil judgment upon release from extended supervision or successful completion of probation.

Court informed defendant he is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program or Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Filed,
-Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
-Notice of Right to Seek Post Conviction Relief;
-Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgment;

Defendant withdraws his plea of not guilty and not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect.

AS TO COUNTS 1, 2 AND 3 OF AMENDED INFORMATION:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction. 
AS TO COUNT 4 OF AMENDED INFORMATION:
State's motion to dismiss and read-in count 4 of the Amended Information granted by the court.

Case adjourned for sentencing hearing in Branch 10.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess firearms.

Per letter received from Attorney Kastenson dated 6-26-2014 stating he will not be filing any motions, 7-24-2014 set for motions is vacated.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. Defendant pled not guilty and not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect.  Court appoints Dr. John Paniewicz to perform NGI examination.  Filed, signed Order for Examination under 971.16. Defendant Christopher M Kosakoski in court with attorney Daryl A. Kastenson.  Defendant Christopher M Kosakoski in custody.  Miriam S. Falk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Pursuant to Sec. 971.14(4)(a), Wisconsin Statutes, copies of the doctor's report are forwarded to Assistant District Attorney Miriam Falk and to the defendant's Attorney, Daryl Kastenson.
Defendant does not contest doctor's report.  Court finds defendant is not competent but likely to become competent.  Case adjourned for return on doctor's report in Branch 10.
Filed, signed Order of Commitment for Treatment.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for June 16, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Report by Dr. Deborah L. Collins received and filed with court.

Defendant Christopher M Kosakoski in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Defendant Christopher M Kosakoski in custody.  Miriam S Falk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause, suspended proceedings and ordered defendant examined by the Wisconsin Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dugan, Branch 10.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for March 11, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  Court ordered no contact with children under the age of 18, no use of the internet, and no possession of child pornography.
